com.pace.jayvee.image.io

Class IncrementingDirectoryWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pace.jayvee.image.io.IncrementingDirectoryWriter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Worker

    public class IncrementingDirectoryWriter
extends Object
implements Worker
    The IncrementingDirectoryWriter creates OutputStreams that can be written into to save images and other data. To get filenames it simply takes an output directory a suffix, and a prefix and increments an index creating: ${directory}/${prefix}${index}${suffix} The directory writer does not append any special characters so if you want your file to have an extension make sure to include a . in the suffix. (e.g. ".png")

    • Field Detail

      • generatedOutputStreams

        public Sink<OutputStream> generatedOutputStreams
        This sink will receive the output streams generated by the directory writer. Those output streams are references to an active file handle and should not be shared or unexpected behavior will likely result.

    • Constructor Detail

        public IncrementingDirectoryWriter()

    • Method Detail

      • setDirectory

        public void setDirectory(String directoryName)
        The directory the output files will be placed in. The path should probably be absolute for maximum portability. Relative paths will be interpreted relative to the location of the working directory when the main was executed.
        Parameters:
        directoryName - A path to a directory to place output files.

      • setPrefix

        public void setPrefix(String prefix)
        A prefix to place before the index. For example, "image-"
        Parameters:
        prefix - The ${prefix} part of ${prefix}${index}${suffix}

      • setSuffix

        public void setSuffix(String suffix)
        A suffix to place after the index. For example, ".png"
        Parameters:
        suffix - The ${suffix} part of ${prefix}${index}${suffix}
